atDirectives.name: @tailwind
atDirectives.description: Use the `@tailwind` directive to insert Tailwind's `base`, `components`, `utilities` and `variants` styles into your CSS.

atDirectives.name: @apply
atDirectives.description: Use `@apply` to inline any existing utility classes into your own custom CSS.

atDirectives.name: @layer
atDirectives.description: Use the `@layer` directive to tell Tailwind which "bucket" a set of custom styles belong to. Valid layers are `base`, `components`, and `utilities`.

atDirectives.name: @variants
atDirectives.description: You can generate responsive, hover, focus, active, and other variants of your own utilities by wrapping their definitions in the `@variants` directive.

atDirectives.name: @responsive
atDirectives.description: You can generate responsive variants of your own classes by wrapping their definitions in the `@responsive` directive.

atDirectives.name: @screen
atDirectives.description: The `@screen` directive allows you to create media queries that reference your breakpoints by name instead of duplicating their values in your own CSS.

atDirectives.name: @theme
atDirectives.description: Tailwind CSS v4 directive to define theme configuration inline in CSS.

atDirectives.name: @custom-variant
atDirectives.description: Tailwind CSS v4 directive to define custom variants for applying conditional styles.

atDirectives.name: @config
atDirectives.description: Tailwind CSS v4 directive to specify configuration options.

atDirectives.name: @source
atDirectives.description: Tailwind CSS v4 directive to specify source paths for content scanning.
